subject: Gardening
title: Butchart Gardens: Quarry to Paradise
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Butchart Gardens: Quarry to Paradise.

hook.text: A depleted limestone quarry in British Columbia became one of the most visited gardens in North America.

buildup.text: Jennie Butchart started planting in the abandoned quarry in 1904, hauling in topsoil by horse cart.

twist.text: Butchart Gardens now draws over a million visitors yearly. The family never sold it or turned it into a theme park.

climax.text: Jennie Butchart proved that environmental damage can be reversedâ€”one cartload of topsoil at a time.

punchline.text: Canada's most beautiful garden was once an ugly quarry.

quiz.question: What was the site of Butchart Gardens before Jennie Butchart transformed it?
options: A lumber mill and sawdust dump
